item.title: CS46-lecture-notes
item.description:
CS 46 Lecture Notes # August 27 # #include <stdio.h> int main() { printf("I <3 C
"); } #include <stdio.h> int main() { for (int i) { printf("I <3 C
"); } } #include <stdio.h> int main() { printf("Enter your agge: "); int age; scanf("%d", &age); // scanf is expecting a decimal (base 10), and stores it in age int dogAge = age * 7; printf("You are %d dog years old 
", dogAge); } To compile:
